column4: Every time I try to use apt-get ot any program that uses apt get I get this Segmentation faultsts... 0%
sounds like your apt binary may have been corrupted
thanks, how do I fix it?
maybe download apt-get from package.ubuntu.com then install it using "sudo dpkg -i"
its probably called "apt"
highlighting me works better if you highlight me instead of him
okay I have installed it, now I shall see if that fixed it
no that didn't work
hrm. could be the package db thats corrup, but if that goes...youre kinda SOL
apt would continue to not work, but i dont think itd be able to regenerate it eithe...
& when I try to start synaptic or gdebi they just instantly crash
no surprise there
both apt-get and aptitude are bad right? what about apt-cache for example?
apt-cache status Segmentation fault
i dont think thats recoverable
any clue what I did?
id guess a power outage mid-update
I haven't had a power outage.
or laptop battery death. or sudden power off...
I am on a desktop
itd most likely be some situation that is a bad-for-filesystem one
according to odinbane deleting the database does actually fix it :p
ok.... sure. i didnt think itd regenerate but ok
at least now you know how to help others with that problem in the future :D
